newsitem.title: USA: U.S. investors to seek rehearing on Lloyd's.
newsitem.headline: U.S. investors to seek rehearing on Lloyd's.

text.p: A group of 93 U.S. investors in Lloyd's of London will ask a U.S. appeals court to reconsider its decision Tuesday lifting an injunction that had kept the the British insurance giant from proceeding with its reorganization, an attorney for the investors said.
"We're planning to file tomorrow afternoon an emergency motion for a rehearing," said Stephens Clay of Kilpatrick & Cody, who represents the investors, known as Names.
If the three-judge panel denies the motion, he said, the plaintiffs will ask the entire U.S. 4th Circuit Court of Appeals to reconsider the matter.
The appeals court panel in Baltimore Tuesday threw out an injunction issued Friday by a U.S. district judge in Richmond Va. that Lloyd's said could have led to its collapse.
The appeals court said the lower court judge erred in imposing the injunction because investors had signed contracts specifying disputes would be settled in British courts.
The appellate court then sent the case back to the district court with instructions to dismiss it.
